newsitem.title: GERMANY: BASF plans polyurethane system house in Malaysia.
newsitem.headline: BASF plans polyurethane system house in Malaysia.

text.p: German chemicals group BASF AG said on Tuesday it plans to build a new polyurethane system house in Malaysia with a capacity of 10,000 metric tonnes.

The new plant, to be completed in the fourth quarter of 1997 and located at Bukit Jelutong industry park in Malaysia, will be built by BASF Polyurethane (Malaysia) Sdn. Bhd., a newly formed subsidiary of the BASF (Malaysia), the group said.

In a polyurethane system house, polyols and auxiliaries are combined with isocyanates to give ready-to-process polyurethane systems used to produce polyurethane foams which are in turn used in the construction and automobile industries.
